name: execute_pycode
description: Execute Python expressions with Python Interpreter, can be used as a simple calculator e.g., (123 + 234) / 23 * 19.

name: execute_mysql_query
description: Execute mysql queries with SQL Intepreter(a Mysql database needed).

sql_cmd.description: The Mysql query to be performed.

password.description: Password to connect to your database.

user.description: The user identity used to connect to the database.

name: exectue_pycode_REPL
description: A tool for running python code in a REPL.

sync.description: Whether to execute the code synchronously.

name: exectue_pycode_REPL_Ast
description: Execute Python expressions with Python Interpreter in REPL.When using this tool, sometimes output is abbreviated - make sure it does not look abbreviated before using it in your answer.

sync.description: Whether to execute the code synchronously.

name: execute_bash_code
description: Run commands in a bash shell and return final output. The input should be a command string

commands.description: The command string to be executed.

strip_newlines.description: Whether to return the result in multiple lines.

return_err_outputpersistent=False.description: Whether to print errors as std outputs when they occur.

persistent.description: Whether to create a persistent child process for the execution(should always be false on Windows)

name: ask_to_user
description: You can ask user for guidance when you think you need more information to handle the task, but you should use this tool as less as you can.

question.description: The question you want to ask to user.

name: finish
description: Finish the task and give your answer.
